tr.td: Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less)

value.displayName: CONCUSSION WITH BRIEF LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS

translation.displayName: Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less)

code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:female aged 32 ys presents with moderate nausea. she also reports severe headache, mild vomiting, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the moderate nausea. a short time ago she sustained a blow to the front of the head (LOC 14 min) o:Height 69 in, Weight 128 lbs, Temperature 98.2 F, Pulse 83, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 70, Respiration 17, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

, MRI Brain Unremarkable , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex , appears

td.content: s:female nanny aged 32 years returns for f/u approx. one (1) week s/p concussion with LOC 14 min. denies headache, nausea and vomiting. First 24-hour hourly checks were without incident. describes drinking an average of 12 drinks a week for about 10 days in her past she has approx. a 30 pack/year history of smoking o:Height 70 in, Weight 129 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 83, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 17, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=97,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=43.0,Reaction Time=0.49, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.
